animations

Class AnimeFrame

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • animations.AnimeFrame

  • public class AnimeFrame
extends java.util.Observable

    The AnimeFrame class binds together an image and it's duration. It contains methods to alter the image and duration and to request them. It also adopts the MVC pattern by extending Observable.

    This class extends Observable but doesn't change any of it's functionality. The only classes that have some advantage of keeping up-to-date with this class are the classes that reference it in their class definition. This includes the classes that use it to store the frames. Any other class observing this is wasting time because it is really uninteresting for them.

    Since:
    7-8-2014
    Version:
    8-8-2014
    Author:
    stefanboodt
    See Also:
    Observable, Image

    • Field Detail

      • DURATION

        public static final java.lang.String DURATION
        The String that tells duration. It is used by notifyObservers(DURATION) which could indicate to listening classes that the duration has changed.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getImage

        protected final java.awt.Image getImage()
        Gets the image.
        Returns:
        The image of the frame.

      • setImage

        protected final void setImage(java.awt.Image image)
        Sets the image to the given value. Notifies the observers that it's image has changed. It calls #notifyObservers(image).
        Parameters:
        image - The new image.

      • getDuration

        protected final long getDuration()
        Queries the duration of the visibility of the frame.
        Returns:
        The duration.

      • setDuration

        protected final void setDuration(long duration)
        Sets the duration the frame is visible. Notifies the observers that it's duration has changed. It calls Observable.notifyObservers(Object). With the given duration. The DURATION is the String declared in this class.
        Parameters:
        duration - The duration of the frame after this point.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object other)
        Checks if two Objects are equal. They are considered equal when the image and duration are equal.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
